intro: Morinda candollei var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy morinda, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dark seeds. Morinda candollei var. villosa is often found in disturbed habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
